arm_group.description: Dexamethasone 8 mg is added to 0.5% ropivacaine 20 ml for sciatic nerve block.
Normal saline 1 ml is added to 0.5% ropivacaine 20 ml for sciatic nerve block.
Epinephrine 1:200,000 is added to 0.5% ropivacaine 20 ml for sciatic nerve block.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the present study is to test that adding dexamethasone or epinephrine
      significantly prolongs the duration of sciatic nerve blocks with ropivacaine and that the
      magnitude of the effect differs among dexamethasone and epinehrine.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Dexamethasone and Epinephrine on the Duration of Sciatic Nerve Blocks With Ropivacaine

detailed_description.textblock:
In a double-blinded trial utilizing single-injection sciatic nerve block, patients are
      randomly assigned to one of three groups: control: 0.5% ropivacaine adding normal saline;
      epinephrine: 0.5% ropivacaine adding epinephrine; dexamethasone: 0.5% ropivacaine adding
      dexamethasone. We assess time to first analgesic request after post-anaesthesia care unit
      discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I and II

          -  patients undergoing elective hallux valgus repair

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients receiving chronic analgesic therapy

          -  diabetes

          -  peripheral neuropathies

          -  psychiatric disorders

          -  hypersensitivity to amide local anesthetics

          -  renal disorders

intervention.description: In dexamethasone group, dexamethasone 8 mg is added to 0.5% ropivacaine 20 ml for sciatic nerve block.
Epinephrine 1:200,000 is added to 0.5% ropivacaine 20 ml for sciatic nerve block

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yeungnam University hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Dexamethasone and Epinephrine on the Duration of Sciatic Nerve Blocks With Ropivacaine in Ankle and Foot Surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, College of medicine, Yeungnam University, Daemyung-Dong, Nam-Gu, Daegu, Republic of Korea

primary_outcome.description: A blinded observer interview patients at arrival in postanesthetic care unit, 6 hour, 24 hour, 48 hour, 72 hour after operation.
primary_outcome.measure: time to first analgesic request after postanesthetic care unit discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: from arrival in postanesthetic care unit to 72 hours after operation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The time of recovery of motor (ability to move the ankle) and sensory (recovery of normal pinprick sensation) functions on the operated foot is recorded by the blinded observer at arrival in postanesthetic care unit, 6 hour, 24 hour, 48 hour, 72 hour after operation.
secondary_outcome.measure: time of recovery of motor and sensory functions on the operated foot
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from arrival in postanesthetic care unit to 72 hours after operation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
